overview: "Transit" is the director's film diary about a trip whose farewell was marked by social unrest in Mexico City. The first stop is Barcelona, ​​which portrays his immigrant status and uprooting parades, along with loss of identity and the Spanish economic crisis. That crisis will become the reason for a renewed flight to Morocco to investigate a case of injustice, then would come Russia and the new illusions of love and afterwards a new departure to the Sahara Desert, with its confused dreams and its paths of no return.
tagline: The personal matters are the most political, beginning with the letters of love.
title: Transit
